snippet: As the shock from the beheadings of two Japanese faded, a battle to gain political advantage from the deaths began.
abstract: Political maneuvering begins in Japan in wake of beheadings of two Japanese hostagers by Islamic State; Prime Min Shinzo Abe requests eased legal restrictions on mlitary, enabling it to take part in police actions overseas; he also suggests amending Constitution to protect its citizens abroad.
lead_paragraph: As the shock from the beheadings of two Japanese faded, a battle to gain political advantage from the deaths began.

headline.main: Beheadings Frame a New Debate About Restraints on Japan’s Military
headline.print_headline: Beheadings Frame a New Debate About Restraints on Japan’s Military

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
